Classic Film and Television Home Page (with many articles on directors)

Favorite Films by Year: Introduction

This article lists my favorite films, by year. All are films I personally saw and enjoyed.

These lists usually begin with feature films, followed by a list of short films. In early silent days, up through 1912, there are often ONLY short films in the year's list.

Silent and Sound features:

Films up through and including 1928 are mainly silent.

1929 features are broken into categories, silent and sound.

Feature films from 1930 on are mainly sound films.

Please see also my consolidated list of The Best Movies of All Time.

What I Like. There are some common subject matter aspects of the recent films:

Many are historical dramas, and deal with major historical subjects;

Many take place in unique modern day institutions and cultures;

Many involve social commentary and important issues.

Several are based on novels, or have a novel-like complexity in their scripts.

And about their lead characters:

Many have scientists, thinkers or artists as heroes.

Few are about villains or violent characters.

The heroes come from a high diversity of backgrounds, in race, religion and sexual orientation.

Most heroes are high energy, productive and optimistic people.

Many heroes perform unusual actions, are innovators or do the socially unexpected.

And in technique:

Many of the films are richly colorful in sets and costumes.

The films have complex plots, characters and dialogue: rich storytelling.

Most of the films respect the audience's intelligence.
